TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HtmlElementCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example uses HtmlElementCollection objects to print out a textual representation of the Document Object Model (DOM) of a page.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/HtmlElementProject/Form1.vb#1)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/HtmlElementProjectCSharp/Form1.cs#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of elements in the collection.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> representing the number of elements in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example finds a `FORM` object using its name, and submits its data to the server programmatically. The code example requires that your application hosts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control named `webBrowser1`.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/HtmlElementProject/Form1.vb#10)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/HtmlElementProjectCSharp/Form1.cs#10)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElementCollection GetElementsByName(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name or ID of the element.
Docs.summary: Gets a collection of elements by their name.
Docs.returns: An containing the elements whose <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement.Name%2A> property match .

remarks.format:
## Remarks While the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement.Id%2A> property of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement> must be unique, multiple elements can use the same <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement.Name%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example finds a `FORM` object using its name, and submits its data to the server programmatically. The code example requires that your application hosts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control named `webBrowser1`.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/HtmlElementProject/Form1.vb#10)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/HtmlElementProjectCSharp/Form1.cs#10)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> that can be used to iterate through the collection.

Docs.param: The position from which to retrieve an item from the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets an item from the collection by specifying its numerical index.
Docs.value: An item from the collection by specifying its numerical index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Elements in an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElementCollection> are not guaranteed to be in source code order. In other words, just because a `DIV` element is the first element inside of a `BODY` tag does not mean that the first element of the collection will be the `DIV` element.

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement.Name%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement.Id%2A> attribute of the element.
Docs.summary: Gets an item from the collection by specifying its name.
Docs.value: An , if the named element is found. Otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example finds a `FORM` object using its name, and submits its data to the server programmatically. The code example requires that your application hosts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control named `webBrowser1`.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/HtmlElementProject/Form1.vb#10)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/HtmlElementProjectCSharp/Form1.cs#10)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(class System.Array dest, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The one-dimensional <xref:System.Array> that is the destination of the elements copied from collection. The <xref:System.Array> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in `array` at which copying begins.
Docs.summary: Copies the elements of the collection to an <xref:System.Array>, starting at a particular <xref:System.Array> index.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the is synchronized (thread safe).
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection>.
